### Janitorial Services – Canada-Saskatchewan Irrigation Diversification Centre (CSIDC)

### Summary
*Title:* Janitorial Services for Canada-Saskatchewan Irrigation Diversification Centre (CSIDC)
*Contractor:* Must be a registered vendor with Agriculture and Agri-Food Canada (AAFC)
*Duration:* 1-year contract with the possibility of extension for 4 additional 1-year periods
*Tendering Method:* Competitive bid solicitation
*Location:* Canada-Saskatchewan Irrigation Diversification Centre (CSIDC)

### Regulations and Exigences
	* All contractors/offerors must possess a valid RELIABILITY STATUS, granted or approved by Agriculture and Agri-Food Canada (AAFC), to access sensitive work sites.
	* Bidders must adhere to the technical and financial evaluation criteria outlined in the bid solicitation.
	* Selecting and evaluating quality bidders is based on compliance with *request for proposal (RFP)* document.

### Mandatory Site Visit
A mandatory site visit is scheduled for January 23, 2024 at 10:00 am CST. Attendance is required for successful bidders.
[Bidder to communicate with Site Authority (Don David) prior to site visit to confirm attendance.](mailto:donald.david@agr.gc.ca)

### Procurement Category and Notice Type
*Procurement Category:* Service – Provision of technical services
*Notice Type:* Request for Proposal

### Contract Scheduling
	* The contract start date is expected to be on April 1, 2024
	* A one-year contract duration with the possibility to extend the contract for 4 additional one-year periods.

### Additional Information

	* Documents may be submitted in both official languages of Canada (English and French).
	* Interested bidders can access the information through GETS (Government Electronic Tendering Service) at [https://canadabuys.canada.ca/en/solicitation-opportunities](https://canadabuys.canada.ca/en/solicitation-opportunities)
	* Joint and several guarantee of completion and pain of damages might be required.
	* The bidding process has certain security and confidentiality requirements which must be adhered to.
